alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 3:53AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF PERRY...FULTON...FRANKLIN... CUMBERLAND...JUNIATA...AND HUNTINGDON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half of a mile and quickly leave a coating of snow on roads. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 352 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 22 miles northwest of Shippensburg to 23 miles north of McConnellsburg to 15 miles south of Huntingdon to 12 miles southeast of Hollidaysburg and moving southeast at 25 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Rockhill Furnace around 355 AM EST. Big Spring State Park around 405 AM EST. Doylesburg around 410 AM EST. Willow Hill around 420 AM EST. Waterfall and Roxbury around 430 AM EST. Fannettsburg and Upper Strasburg around 435 AM EST. * This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 176 to 207. Interstate 81 from mile markers 14 to 33. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
